alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:54AM PST until January 12 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2500 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts of 5 to 7 inches across higher mountains. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning above 3000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches but higher amounts of 12 to 20 inches across higher mountains. Winds gusting up to 30 mph. * WHERE...The Winter Weather Advisory includes the Eastern Douglas County Foothills above 2500 feet through this evening. This includes Toketee Falls and portions of highway 138. The Winter Storm Warning includes areas above 3000 feet in the Eastern Douglas County Foothills including Toketee Falls and higher portions of highway 138. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected near 2500 feet in showers through Thursday evening. Snow levels rise to around 3000 feet on Friday as snow increases. Snow levels will rise to 3500 to 4000 feet Friday night then to 4000 to 5500 feet on Saturday with snow changing to rain, except for additional snow over the higher mountains in the eastern Douglas County Foothills. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
